intro: Clidemia deppeana, commonly known as Hawaiian whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Clidemia deppeana is adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments, typically found in coastal and lowland forests.
